intro: Tragacantha agraniotii, commonly known as the Greek tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and pod-like fruits. The plant is known for producing a gum, similar to tragacanth, which has been used historically in various applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
